title: Add external literature search (PubMed/arXiv) to zotero-comfort
description:
Extend zotero-comfort with complete external search capabilities:

## Goal
Full-featured PubMed and arXiv integration with all 16 PubMed MCP tools.

## PubMed Implementation (via Biopython - same as MCP servers use)

### Search & Discovery (6 tools)
1. search_articles - Search by keywords, authors, journals, dates, MeSH
2. advanced_search - Complex queries with boolean operators
3. search_by_author - Author-specific search with affiliation filtering
4. search_by_journal - Journal-specific search with date ranges
5. search_by_mesh_terms - Medical Subject Headings search
6. get_trending_articles - Recently published in specific fields

### Article Retrieval (4 tools)
7. get_article_details - Full metadata and abstract by PMID
8. get_abstract - Abstract retrieval
9. get_full_text - PMC full text when available
10. batch_article_lookup - Efficient batch retrieval (up to 200 PMIDs)

### Citation & References (4 tools)
11. get_cited_by - Find citing articles
12. get_references - Get reference list
13. get_similar_articles - Content similarity search
14. export_citation - APA, MLA, Chicago, BibTeX, RIS formats

### Utility (2 tools)
15. validate_pmid - Validate and check existence
16. convert_identifiers - PMID ↔ DOI ↔ PMC ID conversion

## arXiv Implementation
- Search by category, author, title
- Get paper metadata
- Download PDFs

## High-Level Workflows
- search_pubmed_to_collection() - Your 'PROMs' use case
- search_arxiv_to_collection()
- search_multi_source_to_collection() - Deduplicated multi-source
- build_reading_list_from_citations() - Start from key paper, expand via citations

## Dependencies
- biopython>=1.80 (NCBI Entrez utilities)
- arxiv>=2.0 (arXiv API client)

## MCP Tools
Expose all 16 PubMed tools + arXiv tools + orchestration workflows via MCP server.

title: Refactor ZoteroMCPClient to native async
description:
## Problem
The ZoteroMCPClient uses asyncio.run() internally which conflicts with FastAPI's event loop.
Currently using ThreadPoolExecutor workaround in http_server.py - works but adds overhead.

## Proposed Solution
1. Make _call_tool_async the primary interface
2. Remove asyncio.run() from call_tool
3. Add proper async methods throughout client.py, proxy.py, workflows.py
4. HTTP server can then call async methods directly

## Benefits
- No thread pool overhead
- Proper async/await throughout
- Better resource utilization
- Cleaner code
